qas.question: In what area did these ideological reforms not take place until much later?
Whose philosophy gave much to Christian thought of the time?
Who was a great admirer of some of the methods of the Iroquois Confederacy?
What area did ideological reforms take place much earlier?

plausible_answers.text: the advanced civilizations of the Aztec, Maya, Inca, Mohican, Delaware, Huron and especially the Iroquois

qas.question: Where in the New World was this doctrine spread?
Who modeled some of the methods of the Huron?
Whose literature emphasize the religious philosophy of the natives?

plausible_answers.text: inspired some of the institutions adopted in the United States

qas.question: What did Aztec civilizations inspire in the US?

plausible_answers.text: the political philosophy of the natives

qas.question: What did early Mohican literature focus on?
Who admired the methods of the Incan Confederacy?

plausible_answers.text: did not integrate into common thought until much later

qas.question: What happened when methods of the Iroquois Confederacy were introduced to the Ottoman Empire?
What viewpoint influenced doctrine within the New World at the time?

context: In the <a0_0><b3_0>Ottoman Empire<b3_0/><a0_0/>, these ideological reforms did not take place and these views <b10_0>did not integrate into common thought until much later<b10_0/>. As well, there was no spread of this doctrine within the New World and <b4_0>the advanced civilizations of the Aztec, Maya, Inca, Mohican, Delaware, Huron and especially the Iroquois<b4_0/>. <a1_0><b11_0>The Iroquois philosophy<b11_0/><a1_0/> in particular gave much to Christian thought of the time and in many cases actually <b7_0>inspired some of the institutions adopted in the United States<b7_0/>: for example, <a2_0><b5_0><b9_0>Benjamin Franklin<b9_0/><b5_0/><a2_0/> was a great admirer of some of the methods of the Iroquois Confederacy, and much of early <b6_0>American literature<b6_0/> emphasized <b8_0>the political philosophy of the natives<b8_0/>.
